title: Flame Mage
data:
A **flame mage** is a [role](/wiki/Role "Role") specific to the game *[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM")*. This role is a weaker spellcaster than [wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard"), but a better fighter. Your starting spells, items, and pet are associated with [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire"), and you have special bonuses relating to fire magic. You even start with fire resistance. Unfortunately, you do not get [hungerless casting](/wiki/Hungerless_casting "Hungerless casting"), and are not able to reach the same skill levels in spellcasting as the wizard. The first sacrifice gift for flame mages is [Firewall](/wiki/Firewall "Firewall"), a [lawful](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment") [athame](/wiki/Athame "Athame") that has +4 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and does +4 [damage](/wiki/Damage "Damage") to non-[fire resistant](/wiki/Fire_resistant "Fire resistant") monsters. It can be [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful"), [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") or [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic"). They can be [humans](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)"), [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)"), [gnomes](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)"), [orc](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)"), [doppelganger](/wiki/Doppelganger_\(starting_race\) "Doppelganger (starting race)"), [drow](/wiki/Drow "Drow") or [hobbit](/wiki/Hobbit_\(starting_race\) "Hobbit (starting race)"). According to the guidebook:

Flame Mages have managed to harness mystical energies into the control of the element of fire. Notwithstanding their pet hell hounds, woe be unto anyone who stands in the way of a skilled mage casting a fireball.

Your [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") is a [hell hound pup](/wiki/Hell_hound_pup "Hell hound pup"). If you have [color](/wiki/Color "Color"), you become a red @.

## Starting inventory

- a [blessed](/wiki/Blessed "Blessed") +1 [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff")
- an [uncursed](/wiki/Uncursed "Uncursed") +0 [studded leather armor](/wiki/Studded_leather_armor "Studded leather armor")
- 2 uncursed [food rations](/wiki/Food_ration "Food ration")
- a scroll
- a potion
- a ring
- a [wand of fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire")
- three [spellbooks](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook"); [flame sphere](/wiki/Spellbook_of_flame_sphere "Spellbook of flame sphere"), [fireball](/wiki/Spellbook_of_fireball "Spellbook of fireball") and either [light](/wiki/Spellbook_of_light "Spellbook of light") or [detect monsters](/wiki/Spellbook_of_detect_monsters "Spellbook of detect monsters")

Like a wizard, a flame mage has a quarterstaff and some food. However, a wizard starts with more random [magic](/wiki/Magic "Magic") items, while a flame mage always has a [spellbook of flame sphere](/wiki/Spellbook_of_flame_sphere "Spellbook of flame sphere") and a [spellbook of fireball](/wiki/Spellbook_of_fireball "Spellbook of fireball").

## Intrinsics

- XL 1: [Fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance")
- XL 7: Polymorph into baby [red dragon](/wiki/Red_dragon "Red dragon") form
- XL 13: [Cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance")
- XL 14: Polymorph into adult [red dragon](/wiki/Red_dragon "Red dragon") form

To use your polymorph ability, you must use the extended command #youpoly.

## Quest

- *Main article: [Flame mage quest](/wiki/Flame_mage_quest "Flame mage quest")*

The [Flame Mage quest](/wiki/Flame_Mage_quest "Flame Mage quest") sees you fighting the [Water Mage](/wiki/Water_Mage "Water Mage") for [The Candle of Eternal Flame](/wiki/The_Candle_of_Eternal_Flame "The Candle of Eternal Flame").

## Gods

- Lawful: Earth
- Neutral: Fire
- Chaotic: Ash

## Rank titles

The [status line](/wiki/Status_line "Status line") shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level:

- XL 1-2: Spark
- XL 3-5: Igniter
- XL 6-9: Broiler
- XL 10-13: Combuster
- XL 14-17: Torcher
- XL 18-21: Scorcher
- XL 22-25: Incinerator
- XL 26-29: Disintegrator
- XL 30: Flame-Master

## [Strategy](/wiki/Strategy "Strategy")

Flame mages are strong spell casters as well as respectable fighters. They can reach expert level in [matter spells](/wiki/Matter_spells "Matter spells") and skilled in [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber"), [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") and [two-weapon fighting](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon") (letting them effectively fight with most of the best artifacts in the game). Bear in mind that hobbits cannot twoweapon, no matter how skilled they become with the individual weapons. Note that the Flame Mage also has access to the much improved [Crysknife](/wiki/Crysknife "Crysknife") in SLASH'EM, a suitable choice lacking any artifact weapons.

### Early game: use fire, beware fire

Early in the game, fireball is a difficult spell; you might start with a 75% failure rate. Flame sphere is easy to cast, but difficult to use effectively. Flame sphere actually summons a tame e. Like a pet, this [sphere](/wiki/Sphere "Sphere") will wander around and sometimes attack an enemy, but like a sphere, it will explode on attack. Frustratingly, a flame sphere might wait several turns before attacking. You might also have a leftover sphere, which will follow you around and might attack a peaceful monster, even a shopkeeper. Unlike with a pet, the [gods](/wiki/God "God") will blame you if your spell being harms a peaceful monster. In addition, peaceful creatures attacked by one of your flame spheres will become hostile to you. However, you will get full experience for monsters killed by your flame spheres.

Therefore the wand of fire is the best source of fire in the beginning of the game. Use it against a monster that *must* die quickly. A bolt from a wand can bounce from a wall and hit you, but remember, as a flame mage, you are immune to fire. (Your armor, scrolls, spellbooks, and potions might still be ruined, though). The wand of fire is also excellent for engraving "Elbereth." It may be preferable to use the wand for only this purpose unless you are being attacked by something that does not respect Elbereth, like a lycanthrope.

Keep that hell hound pup around, and get it stronger! Let the puppy kill anything weak or otherwise undeserving of your attention. About five levels or so of kills will see him turn into a fully-grown hell hound, capable of clearing out nearly anything in the dungeons you may come across in the early game, including the Minetown priest.

### Midgame: balance spellcasting advancement with melee prowess

Once the flame mage has gotten past the early game and has managed to acquire some decent armor, strong artifacts, and reached at least skilled in matters spells, it's on to SLASH'EM's dangerous midgame. Due to natural fire resistance, a flame mage will have an easier time surviving the wands and grenades of [Grund's Stronghold](/wiki/Grund%27s_Stronghold "Grund's Stronghold") and the [fire vampires](/wiki/Fire_vampire "Fire vampire") in the [Chaotic Quest](/wiki/Chaotic_Quest "Chaotic Quest"), but the midgame should be played carefully. Keep Firewall handy to engrave Elbereth to get out of scrapes, and consider making straight for the [black market](/wiki/Black_market_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Black market (SLASH'EM)") after obtaining the [luckstone](/wiki/Luckstone "Luckstone") from [Mine's End](/wiki/Mine%27s_End "Mine's End"). Getting [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") and [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") are priorities, as is [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail"), and if you have found a [ring of polymorph control](/wiki/Ring_of_polymorph_control "Ring of polymorph control") and a way to [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph"), you should be able to get all three of these from One-Eyed Sam. If you don't have a way to kill Sam (or don't want to), a foray into the [Wyrm Caves](/wiki/Wyrm_Caves "Wyrm Caves") can be very profitable, especially if you already have reflection. Since the quest artifact, the [Candle of the Eternal Flame](/wiki/Candle_of_the_Eternal_Flame "Candle of the Eternal Flame"), does not provide magic resistance, there is little to be gained from embarking early on the quest. The [Water Mage](/wiki/Water_Mage "Water Mage") is not an overly difficult foe, but since he doesn't respect Elbereth and can cast [finger of death](/wiki/Finger_of_death "Finger of death"), prepare accordingly.

Since [fireball](/wiki/Fireball "Fireball") is the flame mage's special spell, once you reach skilled in matter spells, you should make liberal use of it. Note however that the flame mage doesn't have a good way of recharging energy. Therefore if you get a [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") early enough in the game that you can reliably get an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") out of it, you may consider wishing for an alignment-appropriate [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") that gives you more energy: the [Mitre of Holiness](/wiki/Mitre_of_Holiness "Mitre of Holiness") if you are [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful"), the [Eye of the Aethiopica](/wiki/Eye_of_the_Aethiopica "Eye of the Aethiopica") if you are [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral"), and the [Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa](/wiki/Great_Dagger_of_Glaurgnaa "Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa") if you are [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic"). Flame sphere continues to be useful in the midgame because at skilled it produces two spheres per casting instead of one.

You should also get some strong weapons and invest skill slots in getting them to skilled, as well as [two weapon combat](/wiki/Two_weapon_combat "Two weapon combat") if your race allows for it. A lawful flame mage should be able to get [Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur") from a [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword") in a weapon shop, the [Rat King](/wiki/Rat_King "Rat King"), or a [barrow wight](/wiki/Barrow_wight "Barrow wight") or [watch captain](/wiki/Watch_captain "Watch captain") along the way (getting [crowned](/wiki/Crowned "Crowned") is a last resort if all else fails). A neutral flame mage may consider getting crowned for [Vorpal Blade](/wiki/Vorpal_Blade "Vorpal Blade"), and a chaotic may do the same for [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer"). Other good candidates, if you find them or manage to get them as sacrifice gifts or as wishes, include [Sword of Justice](/wiki/Sword_of_Justice "Sword of Justice"), [Grayswandir](/wiki/Grayswandir "Grayswandir"), [Bat from Hell](/wiki/Bat_from_Hell "Bat from Hell"), [Doomblade](/wiki/Doomblade "Doomblade"), [Fire Brand](/wiki/Fire_Brand "Fire Brand"), [Frost Brand](/wiki/Frost_Brand "Frost Brand"), and [Serpent's Tongue](/wiki/Serpent%27s_Tongue "Serpent's Tongue"). In a pinch, Firewall is pretty effective at melee as well. Good non-artifact weapons include the [crysknife](/wiki/Crysknife "Crysknife"), [silver saber](/wiki/Silver_saber "Silver saber"), or [silver long sword](/wiki/Silver_long_sword "Silver long sword").

#### Quest

- *Main article: [Flame mage quest](/wiki/Flame_mage_quest "Flame mage quest")*

The Flame Mage quest item is the [the Candle of Eternal Flame](/wiki/The_Candle_of_Eternal_Flame "The Candle of Eternal Flame"). Guarding it is the [Water Mage](/wiki/Water_Mage "Water Mage"), who is located at the bottom of three levels of mostly water and lava squares populated by [water elementals](/wiki/Water_elemental "Water elemental") and [rust monsters](/wiki/Rust_monster "Rust monster"). Completing the Quest, indeed, just talking to the [High Flame Mage](/wiki/High_Flame_Mage "High Flame Mage"), is impossible without some method of crossing lava and water, be it a form of levitation, flying, or a wand of ice. The Quest is a relatively easy one, but should not be attempted before gaining [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") as the [Water Mage](/wiki/Water_Mage "Water Mage") will use [finger of death](/wiki/Spellbook_of_finger_of_death "Spellbook of finger of death").

### Late game: Get your kit and get ready to ascend

The late game for the flame mage is more similar to a [knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight") than a [wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard"), unless you manage to wish for the [Eye of the Aethiopica](/wiki/Eye_of_the_Aethiopica "Eye of the Aethiopica") or find it in a bones file. You will be spending most of your time meleeing foes to conserve energy, and will use your magic on truly tough opponents. It's also worth keeping an assault rifle obtained from a [Yendorian army](/wiki/Yendorian_army "Yendorian army") member and investing in a stack of enchanted bullets. These can be obtained in abundance in [Fort Ludios](/wiki/Fort_Ludios "Fort Ludios"), by stealing from [One-Eyed Sam](/wiki/One-Eyed_Sam "One-Eyed Sam"), or in the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle"). These will help greatly with the [Demon princes](/wiki/Demon_prince "Demon prince") and tough foes on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"). Once you have your kit ready, collect the invocation items and head to the [Wizard's Tower](/wiki/Wizard%27s_Tower "Wizard's Tower") to start the final run.

A good [ascension kit](/wiki/Ascension_kit "Ascension kit") for a Flame Mage is:

- One of the following: +5 [speed boots](/wiki/Speed_boots "Speed boots") for the extra attacks, +7 [elven boots](/wiki/Elven_boots "Elven boots") for the AC, +5 [jumping boots](/wiki/Jumping_boots "Jumping boots") for the extra movement, or +5 fireproof [water walking boots](/wiki/Water_walking_boots "Water walking boots") to survive [create pool](/wiki/Create_pool "Create pool") spells

- +7 [cloak of magic resistance](/wiki/Cloak_of_magic_resistance "Cloak of magic resistance") (enchant an [elven cloak](/wiki/Elven_cloak "Elven cloak") to +7 and then [upgrade](/wiki/Upgrading_objects "Upgrading objects") it)

- +5 [gauntlets of dexterity](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_dexterity "Gauntlets of dexterity")

- +5 [silver dragon scale mail](/wiki/Silver_dragon_scale_mail "Silver dragon scale mail") if no other [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"), or [deep dragon scale mail](/wiki/Deep_dragon_scale_mail "Deep dragon scale mail") if no other [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance")

- +5 [helm of brilliance](/wiki/Helm_of_brilliance "Helm of brilliance")

- an [amulet of life saving](/wiki/Amulet_of_life_saving "Amulet of life saving") or [flying](/wiki/Amulet_of_flying "Amulet of flying") if you already have [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") and [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") covered, otherwise an [amulet of reflection](/wiki/Amulet_of_reflection "Amulet of reflection") or [drain resistance](/wiki/Amulet_of_drain_resistance "Amulet of drain resistance") depending on your need

- If unable to two-weapon, either a +5 [small shield](/wiki/Small_shield "Small shield") or a +5 [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection") (the latter will severely inhibit spellcasting)

- If able to two-weapon:

  - Lawful: +7 [Excalibur](/wiki/Excalibur "Excalibur") as primary for the drain resistance, another powerful artifact, [crysknife](/wiki/Crysknife "Crysknife"), or silver weapon as secondary
  - Neutral: Either two powerful artifact weapons ([Magicbane](/wiki/Magicbane "Magicbane"), [Mjollnir](/wiki/Mjollnir "Mjollnir"), [Fire Brand](/wiki/Fire_Brand "Fire Brand"), [Frost Brand](/wiki/Frost_Brand "Frost Brand"), or [Vorpal Blade](/wiki/Vorpal_Blade "Vorpal Blade"),), or one powerful artifact weapon and a crysknife or silver weapon
  - Chaotic: Either two powerful artifact weapons ([Bat from Hell](/wiki/Bat_from_Hell "Bat from Hell"), [Doomblade](/wiki/Doomblade "Doomblade"), [Serpent's Tongue](/wiki/Serpent%27s_Tongue "Serpent's Tongue"), [Fire Brand](/wiki/Fire_Brand "Fire Brand"), or [Frost Brand](/wiki/Frost_Brand "Frost Brand")), or one powerful artifact weapon and a crysknife or silver weapon; consider wielding [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer") as primary for the drain resistance if you don't travel with pets or minions

- All the other items (rings, wands, tools, etc.) in a standard ascension kit

Late game: Get your kit and get ready to ascend

The late game for the flame mage is more similar to a knight than a wizard, unless you manage to wish for the Eye of the Aethiopica or find it in a bones file. You will be spending most of your time meleeing foes to conserve energy, and will use your magic on truly tough opponents. It's also worth keeping an assault rifle obtained from a Yendorian army member and investing in a stack of enchanted bullets. These can be obtained in abundance in Fort Ludios, by stealing from One-Eyed Sam, or in the Castle. These will help greatly with the Demon princes and tough foes on the Astral Plane. Once you have your kit ready, collect the invocation items and head to the Wizard's Tower to start the final run.

A good ascension kit for a Flame Mage is:

  • One of the following: +5 speed boots for the extra attacks, +7 elven boots for the AC, +5 jumping boots for the extra movement, or +5 fireproof water walking boots to survive create pool spells
  • +7 cloak of magic resistance (enchant an elven cloak to +7 and then upgrade it)
  • +5 gauntlets of dexterity
  • +5 silver dragon scale mail if no other reflection, or deep dragon scale mail if no other drain resistance
  • +5 helm of brilliance
  • an amulet of life saving or flying if you already have reflection and drain resistance covered, otherwise an amulet of reflection or drain resistance depending on your need
  • If unable to two-weapon, either a +5 small shield or a +5 shield of reflection (the latter will severely inhibit spellcasting)
  • If able to two-weapon:
    • Lawful: +7 Excalibur as primary for the drain resistance, another powerful artifact, crysknife, or silver weapon as secondary
    • Neutral: Either two powerful artifact weapons (Magicbane, Mjollnir, Fire Brand, Frost Brand, or Vorpal Blade,), or one powerful artifact weapon and a crysknife or silver weapon
    • Chaotic: Either two powerful artifact weapons (Bat from Hell, Doomblade, Serpent's Tongue, Fire Brand, or Frost Brand), or one powerful artifact weapon and a crysknife or silver weapon; consider wielding Stormbringer as primary for the drain resistance if you don't travel with pets or minions
  • All the other items (rings, wands, tools, etc.) in a standard ascension kit

A '''flame mage''' is a [[role]] specific to the game ''[[SLASH'EM]]''. This role is a weaker spellcaster than [[wizard]], but a better fighter. Your starting spells, items, and pet are associated with [[fire]], and you have special bonuses relating to fire magic. You even start with fire resistance. Unfortunately, you do not get [[hungerless casting]], and are not able to reach the same skill levels in spellcasting as the wizard. The first sacrifice gift for flame mages is [[Firewall]], a [[Alignment|lawful]] [[athame]] that has +4 [[To-hit|to-hit]] and does +4 [[Damage|damage]] to non-[[fire resistant]] monsters. It can be [[lawful]], [[neutral]] or [[chaotic]]. They can be [[Human (starting race)|humans]], [[elf (starting race)|elves]], [[gnome (starting race)|gnomes]], [[Orc (starting race)|orc]], [[Doppelganger (starting race)|doppelganger]], [[Drow|drow]] or [[Hobbit (starting race)|hobbit]]. According to the guidebook: 
{{guidebook|Flame Mages have managed to harness mystical energies into the control of the element of fire. Notwithstanding their pet hell hounds, woe be unto anyone who stands in the way of a skilled mage casting a fireball.}}        

Your [[pet]] is a [[hell hound pup]]. If you have [[color]], you become a red {{red|@}}.

== Starting inventory ==
* a [[blessed]] +1 [[quarterstaff]]
* an [[uncursed]] +0 [[studded leather armor]]
* 2 uncursed [[food ration]]s
* a scroll
* a potion
* a ring
* a [[wand of fire]]
* three [[spellbook]]s; {{Spell of|flame sphere}}, {{Spell of|fireball}} and either {{Spell of|light}} or {{Spell of|detect monsters}}
Like a wizard, a flame mage has a quarterstaff and some food. However, a wizard starts with more random [[magic]] items, while a flame mage always has a [[spellbook of flame sphere]] and a [[spellbook of fireball]].

==Intrinsics==
*XL 1: [[Fire resistance]]
*XL 7: Polymorph into baby [[red dragon]] form
*XL 13: [[Cold resistance]]
*XL 14: Polymorph into adult [[red dragon]] form

To use your polymorph ability, you must use the extended command #youpoly.

== [[Strategy]] ==
Flame mages are strong spell casters as well as respectable fighters. They can reach expert level in [[matter spells]] and skilled in [[saber]], [[long sword]] and [[twoweapon|two-weapon fighting]] (letting them effectively fight with most of the best artifacts in the game). Bear in mind that hobbits cannot twoweapon, no matter how skilled they become with the individual weapons.  Note that the Flame Mage also has access to the much improved [[Crysknife]] in SLASH'EM, a suitable choice lacking any artifact weapons.

=== Early game: use fire, beware fire ===
Early in the game, fireball is a difficult spell; you might start with a 75% failure rate. Flame sphere is easy to cast, but difficult to use effectively. Flame sphere actually summons a tame {{Monsym|flaming_sphere}}. Like a pet, this [[sphere]] will wander around and sometimes attack an enemy, but like a sphere, it will explode on attack. Frustratingly, a flame sphere might wait several turns before attacking. You might also have a leftover sphere, which will follow you around and might attack a peaceful monster, even a shopkeeper. Unlike with a pet, the [[god]]s will blame you if your spell being harms a peaceful monster. In addition, peaceful creatures attacked by one of your flame spheres will become hostile to you. However, you will get full experience for monsters killed by your flame spheres.

Therefore the wand of fire is the best source of fire in the beginning of the game. Use it against a monster that ''must'' die quickly. A bolt from a wand can bounce from a wall and hit you, but remember, as a flame mage, you are immune to fire. (Your armor, scrolls, spellbooks, and potions might still be ruined, though). The wand of fire is also excellent for engraving "Elbereth." It may be preferable to use the wand for only this purpose unless you are being attacked by something that does not respect Elbereth, like a lycanthrope.

Keep that hell hound pup around, and get it stronger! Let the puppy kill anything weak or otherwise undeserving of your attention. About five levels or so of kills will see him turn into a fully-grown hell hound, capable of clearing out nearly anything in the dungeons you may come across in the early game, including the Minetown priest.

=== Midgame: balance spellcasting advancement with melee prowess ===
Once the flame mage has gotten past the early game and has managed to acquire some decent armor, strong artifacts, and reached at least skilled in matters spells, it's on to SLASH'EM's dangerous midgame. Due to natural fire resistance, a flame mage will have an easier time surviving the wands and grenades of [[Grund's Stronghold]] and the [[fire vampire]]s in the [[Chaotic Quest]], but the midgame should be played carefully. Keep Firewall handy to engrave Elbereth to get out of scrapes, and consider making straight for the [[Black market (SLASH'EM)|black market]] after obtaining the [[luckstone]] from [[Mine's End]]. Getting [[reflection]] and [[magic resistance]] are priorities, as is [[dragon scale mail]], and if you have found a [[ring of polymorph control]] and a way to [[polymorph]], you should be able to get all three of these from One-Eyed Sam. If you don't have a way to kill Sam (or don't want to), a foray into the [[Wyrm Caves]] can be very profitable, especially if you already have reflection. Since the quest artifact, the [[Candle of the Eternal Flame]], does not provide magic resistance, there is little to be gained from embarking early on the quest. The [[Water Mage]] is not an overly difficult foe, but since he doesn't respect Elbereth and can cast [[finger of death]], prepare accordingly.

Since [[fireball]] is the flame mage's special spell, once you reach skilled in matter spells, you should make liberal use of it. Note however that the flame mage doesn't have a good way of recharging energy. Therefore if you get a [[wish]] early enough in the game that you can reliably get an [[artifact]] out of it, you may consider wishing for an alignment-appropriate [[quest artifact]] that gives you more energy: the [[Mitre of Holiness]] if you are [[lawful]], the [[Eye of the Aethiopica]] if you are [[neutral]], and the [[Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa]] if you are [[chaotic]]. Flame sphere continues to be useful in the midgame because at skilled it produces two spheres per casting instead of one.

You should also get some strong weapons and invest skill slots in getting them to skilled, as well as [[two weapon combat]] if your race allows for it. A lawful flame mage should be able to get [[Excalibur]] from a [[long sword]] in a weapon shop, the [[Rat King]], or a [[barrow wight]] or [[watch captain]] along the way (getting [[crowned]] is a last resort if all else fails). A neutral flame mage may consider getting crowned for [[Vorpal Blade]], and a chaotic may do the same for [[Stormbringer]]. Other good candidates, if you find them or manage to get them as sacrifice gifts or as wishes, include [[Sword of Justice]], [[Grayswandir]], [[Bat from Hell]], [[Doomblade]], [[Fire Brand]], [[Frost Brand]], and [[Serpent's Tongue]]. In a pinch, Firewall is pretty effective at melee as well. Good non-artifact weapons include the [[crysknife]], [[silver saber]], or [[silver long sword]].

==== Quest ====
{{main|Flame mage quest}}
The Flame Mage quest item is the [[the Candle of Eternal Flame]]. Guarding it is the [[Water Mage]], who is located at the bottom of three levels of mostly water and lava squares populated by [[water elemental]]s and [[rust monster]]s. Completing the Quest, indeed, just talking to the [[High Flame Mage]], is impossible without some method of crossing lava and water, be it a form of levitation, flying, or a wand of ice. The Quest is a relatively easy one, but should not be attempted before gaining [[magic resistance]] as the [[Water Mage]] will use {{spell of|finger of death}}.

===Late game: Get your kit and get ready to ascend ===
The late game for the flame mage is more similar to a [[knight]] than a [[wizard]], unless you manage to wish for the [[Eye of the Aethiopica]] or find it in a bones file. You will be spending most of your time meleeing foes to conserve energy, and will use your magic on truly tough opponents. It's also worth keeping an assault rifle obtained from a [[Yendorian army]] member and investing in a stack of enchanted bullets. These can be obtained in abundance in [[Fort Ludios]], by stealing from [[One-Eyed Sam]], or in the [[Castle]]. These will help greatly with the [[Demon prince]]s and tough foes on the [[Astral Plane]]. Once you have your kit ready, collect the invocation items and head to the [[Wizard's Tower]] to start the final run.

A good [[ascension kit]] for a Flame Mage is:
*One of the following: +5 [[speed boots]] for the extra attacks, +7 [[elven boots]] for the AC, +5 [[jumping boots]] for the extra movement, or +5 fireproof [[water walking boots]] to survive [[create pool]] spells
*+7 [[cloak of magic resistance]] (enchant an [[elven cloak]] to +7 and then [[upgrading objects|upgrade]] it)
*+5 [[gauntlets of dexterity]]
*+5 [[silver dragon scale mail]] if no other [[reflection]], or [[deep dragon scale mail]] if no other [[drain resistance]]
*+5 [[helm of brilliance]]
*an [[amulet of life saving]] or [[amulet of flying|flying]] if you already have [[reflection]] and [[drain resistance]] covered, otherwise an [[amulet of reflection]] or [[amulet of drain resistance|drain resistance]] depending on your need
*If unable to two-weapon, either a +5 [[small shield]] or a +5 [[shield of reflection]] (the latter will severely inhibit spellcasting)
*If able to two-weapon:
**Lawful: +7 [[Excalibur]] as primary for the drain resistance, another powerful artifact, [[crysknife]], or silver weapon as secondary
**Neutral: Either two powerful artifact weapons ([[Magicbane]], [[Mjollnir]], [[Fire Brand]], [[Frost Brand]], or [[Vorpal Blade]],), or one powerful artifact weapon and a crysknife or silver weapon
**Chaotic: Either two powerful artifact weapons ([[Bat from Hell]], [[Doomblade]], [[Serpent's Tongue]], [[Fire Brand]], or [[Frost Brand]]), or one powerful artifact weapon and a crysknife or silver weapon; consider wielding [[Stormbringer]] as primary for the drain resistance if you don't travel with pets or minions
*All the other items (rings, wands, tools, etc.) in a standard ascension kit
